page.title: 16Religion in Alrewas/Wychnor
page.content: There are three churches in the area. Two belong to the Church of England and one is a Methodist chapel. The vicar of All Saints, Alrewas is also vicar of Wychnor and Fradley.There are 2 morning services on a Sunday with an average 120 people attending.Afternoon and evening services are held at Wychnor or Fradley.The vicar is always busy preparing and taking services,teaching in the local school,hospital visiting, interviewing people or attending meetings.At present the church is in need of restoration costing 50,000 pounds because the sandstone is wearing away.St. Leonards dates from the 13th century although parts may be earlier. It has a very small congregation.It is surrounded by farming land and looks out over the A38.Alrewas Methodist Chapel is a 19thC. brick building.
